channel.title: parameter on Mezalor
channel.description: Recent content in parameter on Mezalor

item.title: bash, initialisation des variables
item.description: Use a default value ${PARAMETER:-WORD} ${PARAMETER-WORD} If the parameter PARAMETER is unset (never was defined) or null (empty), this one expands to WORD, otherwise it expands to the value of PARAMETER, as if it just was ${PARAMETER}. If you omit the : (colon), like shown in the second form, the default value is only used when the parameter was unset, not when it was empty. Assign a default value ${PARAMETER:=WORD} ${PARAMETER=WORD} This one works like the using default values, but the default text you give is not only expanded, but also assigned to the parameter, if it was unset or null.
